result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Paul Pfeiffer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Paul Pfeiffer appeared by video.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw appeared by video for Michael Paul Pfeiffer.  Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to  11-9-22 at 10:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael Paul Pfeiffer in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting no contact order be modified to a no violent contact order.  State objects.  Court denied defense request to modify no contact order.  Defense is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 9-13-22 at 1:30  pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.16.22
Received and Filed:  Defense's Motion for Modification of Bond Order.

Defendant Michael Paul Pfeiffer in court with Attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061472,
Payable Number: 1017673,
Receipt Number: 22RP027100,
Amount: $20.00

Defense counsel contacted the Court indicating they were retained today and requests indigency hearing to be removed.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing on 7/14/2022 at 1:30 pm, Courthouse Room 504.

Court ordered no contact with ARO;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Paul Pfeiffer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael Paul Pfeiffer in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Paul Pfeiffer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
